meanings.sent1: The dupery of the con artist fooled many people.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the dupery of the scammer.
meanings.sent3: The magician's dupery left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The web of dupery spun by the fraudster unraveled in court.
meanings.sent5: The dupery in the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the end.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone.
meanings.sent1: His dupery was exposed when his lies were uncovered.
meanings.sent2: The dupery of the illusionist amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's playful dupery entertained the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The dupery of the fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The dupery in the movie plot kept viewers on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: The dupery of the Ponzi scheme led to many people losing their savings.
meanings.sent2: She fell victim to the dupery of the online scam.
meanings.sent3: The cat's clever dupery to steal the fish from the kitchen amazed the family.
meanings.sent4: The politician's dupery in promising false benefits was soon revealed.
meanings.sent5: The dupery of the counterfeit products fooled unsuspecting buyers.
